Yes, while the development of advanced technologies like directed energy weapons and hypersonic missiles is likely to change the landscape of naval warfare in the future, there will still be a need for traditional weapons like guns and torpedoes.

Guns, for example, are still useful for engaging targets at shorter ranges, especially when they are positioned in areas that are difficult to hit with missiles. Guns can also be used to intimidate or disable enemy vessels without necessarily destroying them outright.

Torpedoes, on the other hand, will continue to play a vital role in anti-ship and anti-submarine warfare, especially as advancements in torpedo technology continue to make them more effective and versatile.

Furthermore, there are situations where advanced weapons may not be the best option, such as engaging small, fast-moving targets or in close-range combat. In these cases, traditional weapons like guns can often be more effective.

In summary, while there will be significant advancements in naval armament technology in the future, traditional weapons like guns and torpedoes will still be relevant and necessary in certain scenarios.
